dataset.title: STATE

individualName.surName: Kendra Cheruvelil, Michigan State University, Co-Principal Investigator
Patricia Soranno, Michigan State University, Principal Investigator

abstract.para:
LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE STATE layer is a dissolved subset of the 1:1,000,000-Scale County Boundaries of the U.S. dataset from the National Atlas.
Note: Complete metadata is available within the download file. This metadata can be viewed with esri ArcGIS software or by viewing the imbedded .xml file. Coverages and grids contain a file called metadata.xml and shapefiles contain a file called (shapefile_name.xml). These files can be exported to FGDC and ISO metadata formats.

section.title: Use Constraints
section.para: The LAGOS-NE database should be acknowledged in products derived from these data. The citation may include the DOI of the database and/or the accompanying manuscript.

section.title: Data Credit
section.para: METHODS PUBLICATION: Soranno, Patricia A., Edward G. Bissell, Kendra S. Cheruvelil, Samuel T. Christel, Sarah M. Collins, C. Emi Fergus, Christopher T. Filstrup et al. "Building a multi-scaled geospatial temporal ecology database from disparate data sources: fostering open science and data reuse." GigaScience 4, no. 1 (2015): 28. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS: Support for creating LAGOS-NE was provided by the National Science Foundation MacroSystems Biology Program in the Emerging Frontiers Division of the Biological Sciences Directorate (EF-1065786and EF-1638679 to MSU, EF-1065649 to ISU, and EF-1065818 and EF-1638554 to UW) and the USDA National Institute of Food and Agriculture, Hatch project 176820 to PAS. Author KEW thanks the STRIVE Programme (2011-W-FS-7) from the Environmental Protection Agency, Ireland. Author SMC also thanks the NSF Division of Biological Infrastructure (1401954). Further credits for other modules LAGOS-NE beyond the GIS Database are detailed in Soranno et al. 2017.

purpose.para: We have created a database for lakes in the northeastern-most 17 U.S. states called LAGOS-NE (LAke multi-scaled GeOSpatial and temporal database). We had three related motivations for developing this database: (1) to develop the basic understanding of lake nutrients and productivity at sub-continental scales, with a focus on studying cross-scale interactions and their drivers using water quality data on thousands of lakes collected overacross the last several decades (see Soranno et al. 2014 and Soranno et al. 2015 for details); (2) to build the capacity to apply this scientific understanding to environmental management and policy of freshwaters; and, (3) to foster broad-scale research by designing an open-science database infrastructure that includes detailed characterization of lake ecological context that is extensible for future uses and by making the data and methods publicly accessible. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database is provided for the purposes of displaying LAGOS-NE data, understanding their geospatial relationships, and supporting further spatial analyses with these data. The LAGOS-NE STATE layer is one of the spatial classifications that can be used to study regional ecological context at a variety of scales. This layer defined input zones (each polygon feature) for the LAGOS-NE-GEO summary statistics. It is useful to summarize data according to political boundaries, even though they do not align to meaningful ecological/hydrological divisions, because some data that may be useful with LAGOS-NE are only available aggregated by county, state, etc.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE STATE layer is a dissolved subset of the 1:1,000,000-Scale County Boundaries of the U.S. dataset from the National Atlas.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We selected the counties with the STATE column equal to the abbreviations for the 17 states in LAGOS-NE. We dropped county polygons with FIPS codes ending in '000' as these represent boundaries through large water bodies and ocean that are not useful for LAGOS-NE summary data. The data were re-projected. The resulting LAGOS-NE COUNTY dataset was then dissolved on the STATE abbreviation field to yield 17 states for this dataset with boundaries aligned to the county representations.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Area of the polygon, in hectares, where complete NWI data coverage was obtained for analysis in LAGOS-NE.
The latitude of the centroid of the polygon (NAD83).
A unique identifier in LAGOS-NE for the regional spatial classifications (hydrologic units, political regions, or ecological drainage units).

textDomain.definition: Character string contains spatial classification prefix followed by sequentially generated numeric value

attribute.attributeDefinition: The longitude of the centroid of the polygon (NAD83).

textDomain.definition: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The percent area of the polygon for which complete NWI coverage was obtained for analysis in LAGOS-NE.
The 2-digit FIPS code of the State or State equivalent in which the county is located.

parameter.name: Standard Parallel
parameter.description: Line of constant latitude at which the Earth and the plane intersect

parameter.description: The line of logitude at the center of the map projection

parameter.description: A value added in a rectangular coordinate system, usually used to avoid negative values
